item.title: Kerbstone - Trip Hazard, 17th August
item.description:
On Arnsberg Way, Bexleyheath - opposite Bexleyheath Police Station: I reported a damaged kerbstone on the 22nd July - please see report: https://fix.bexley.gov.uk/report/7913423 However, your contractor has done an awful and sub-standard repair by simply throwing some tarmac around the kerbstone. Not only does it look messy, the trip hazard to pedestrians remains as the kerbstone has not been re-set to the correct level - please see the attached picture. Please could you instruct your contractor to return and carry out a proper and safe repair.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Arnsberg Way, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging holly and shubry onto narrow pavement, 17th August
item.description:
Increasing holly overhanging narrow pavement on busy road. double buggy unable to use pavement as holly is spitfull overhanding shruby encroaching onto narrow pavement making walking on busy road very difficult for pedestrians and buggys and children. these issues have been ongoing for many months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Heathfield Lane, Chislehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Weeds growing, 17th August
item.description:
There are a huge amount of weeds growing on the pavement in Alpha Street. It seems like there has been a general lack of cleaning and upkeep on this street and the neighbouring streets in the last few months. Can I please hear from the council on why this is happening. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Alpha Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vegetation needs to be cut back, 17th August
item.description:
Hi Bromley from a Street friend, this Minden Road overgrown pavement issue is getting really bad now, so that you literally cannot walk along it but have to use the road, please can you get Wickes to clear it, I believe you have informed them previously? Thanks very much üëç

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Minden Road, Anerley, London

item.title: Gates to park, 17th August
item.description:
